fawnSecondChoice.choice: 好厉害！还有什么有意思的萤火虫小知识吗？
好了好了，走，找你爸妈去。

wolfStop.line: 狐狸！过来一下！（按空格键继续……）

wolfIntro.line: 你好，狐狸。稍等一下，猫头鹰马上就来。（按空格键继续……）

wolfIntroTouch.line: 你好啊，Peter。（轻点任意处继续……）
你好啊，Peter。（轻点任意处继续……）

intro.line: Why does everyone always call me “Fox?” You know my name is Spencer.
Fox, the water levels are rising and a massive flood is coming.
Our only hope is to |b|build a very large dam|/b| to stop the flood.
OK. Why can’t the beavers build it?
...They’ve gone missing. Nobody has seen them for days.
We don’t have much time. Without the beavers, we’ll need |b|all the animals|/b| in our forest to work |b|together|/b| to build a dam of this size.
And we need |i|you|/i| to get them all to help.

introResponse1.line: I am old and weak and nearly died just flying here to you.
And they are afraid of me, even though I am quite tame and enjoy nothing more than tending my herb garden.
One more thing, Fox. Like us, you are a nocturnal animal and are |b|most comfortable at night|/b|.
But you will need to |b|go out in the daytime|/b| to talk to some animals.
If you find yourself overwhelmed, it’s OK to let off some steam. You’ll feel better.
You may find it difficult, but don’t give up.

introResponse2.line: One more thing, Fox. Like us, you are a nocturnal animal and are |b|most comfortable at night|/b|.
But you will need to |b|go out in the daytime|/b| to talk to some animals.
If you find yourself overwhelmed, it’s OK to let off some steam. You’ll feel better.
You may find it difficult, but don’t give up.

wolfRepetition.line: Try to gather all the animals. Don't give up

wolfNight.line: I’m sure there are some more animals that can help us. Try looking around the forest for them. Don't give up!

wolfDayBear.line: Have you found the bear? She’s usually near the big red tree.

wolfDayBoar.line: The boar could help us with the dam. He’s usually near the pond across the river.

owlEnd.line: Good job, Fox! With all of the animals working together, the dam should be built in no time!
(This is the end of the game. You can wander around now.)

owlFirstNight.line: How was it being out in the daytime, Fox?
You were right—it wasn’t easy. The sun was very bright and the sounds were really loud...
...but it got better when I howled.
I’m glad to hear it. It would be hard for me too if I were out in the daytime.
For you, yes, but not for the daytime animals.
If they had to find their way through the forest at night, I bet you’d be the perfect guide to help them get around!
Thanks, Isaac. I guess everyone is good at different things, right?
I think that’s very wise. And I should know.

bearIntro.line: Hi, Charlene! Long time no see.
Would you be willing to help build a dam to save our forest?

bearEnd.line: I’m glad you’re happy now! So about helping with that dam...

bearThanks2.line: A third honey?! I love you Fox.

bearThanks3.line: Thank you Fox. But I'm afraid of diabetes...

stagIntro.line: Our little fawn has gone missing!
She was with us when we woke up at dusk, but she took off running at sunset.
We chased after her, but we couldn’t find her anywhere. Can you help us find her?
We want to stay here in case she finds her way home on her own.
Sure, I can look for her. What direction was she running in?
Thank you, Fox. It was |b|towards the river|/b|, but I’m not sure why she’d want to go there. She doesn’t like the water very much.
Thanks for looking for her, Fox. We’ll be right here if you find her.

stagIntroRepetition.line: Please help us find our little fawn.

stagThanks.line: Thank you so much for finding our baby!
It was no trouble, really. By the way, have you heard that we’re building a dam?
Yes, we saw someone working on it. We want to help too. You can count on us!

stagThanksRepetition.line: We're working on the dam now.

fawnIntro1.line: My name’s Spencer, but everybody calls me “Fox” for some reason. What’s yours?
Oh, look at how bright their lights are!
Light on...light off. Light on...light off.
Your mom and dad are looking for you.

fawnIntro2.line: Hi again, it’s Spencer. Do you want to go home now?

fawnIntro3.line: Hello? Little fawn? Can you hear me?

fawnFireflies.line: Sure! I love fireflies! Did you know that fireflies “talk” to each other using their light signals?

fawnGoHome.line: OK! Fireflies are neither flies nor bugs. They’re beetles. Isn’t that neat?
OK, I’m ready to go home now. |b|Follow me!|/b|

boarIntro.line: Hey, Elvis, could I get your help with this dam we’re—
Oh no! You’re hurt! How can I help?
OK, I’ll bring you those things right away!

boarEnd1.line: I’m glad you’re feeling better, Elvis! We could really use your help building this dam…

rabbitIntro.line: Good morning, Beulah. Elvis is injured and I could really use your help.
Hey, Beulah, Elvis is hurt. Can you help me find some wheatgrass to heal his wound?
(Maybe she’s busy with something. I’ll come back later.)

rabbitRepetition.line: Beulah, do you have the wheatgrass yet?

ending.line: Well done, Fox. Because of your help, the dam will be completed in no time.
I wonder when the beavers will come back.
What actually happened to the beavers?
